title: Live Updates: France’s Far Right Is Denied a Majority by a Left Surge in Elections
content: With nearly all races called, the far-right National Rally fell short of predictions, but no coalition captured an absolute majority in Parliament. Months of gridlock could lie ahead.
summary: With nearly all races called, the far-right National Rally fell short of predictions, but no coalition captured an absolute majority in Parliament. Months of gridlock could lie ahead.

title: In Rafah, We Saw Destruction and the Limits of Israel’s Gaza Strategy
content: Months after Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu declared that “victory is within reach,” the Israeli military escorted journalists into parts of a devastated Gazan city.
summary: Months after Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu declared that “victory is within reach,” the Israeli military escorted journalists into parts of a devastated Gazan city.

title: Israelis Call for a Cease-Fire Deal and Elections After 9 Months of War

summary: A day of nationwide anti-government protests comes amid signs of progress toward a truce and hostage deal with Hamas, as well as continued fighting.

title: Turnout Is High as France’s Snap Election Enters Its Final Hours
content: The vote will determine the composition of France’s National Assembly, and the future of President Emmanuel Macron’s second term.
summary: The vote will determine the composition of France’s National Assembly, and the future of President Emmanuel Macron’s second term.

title: Deadly Flooding and Landslides in Nepal
content: In this monsoon season, so far there have been more than 60 weather-related fatalities. With roads cut off and more rain expected, the toll could rise.

title: Ukraine Tries to Stay Neutral in Political Dogfight Between Trump and Biden

summary: With President Biden’s future unclear, Donald J. Trump’s support uncertain and a major NATO meeting looming, Ukrainian leaders are straining to keep their balance.

title: Tokyo Governor Yuriko Koike Is Re-elected in Race With 56 Candidates
content: A ridiculous number of candidates contended to be governor of Tokyo and its surrounding prefecture. Many were not even trying to win.

title: The Windmills Are Back Up on the Moulin Rouge
content: The Paris landmark has completed its restoration after the blades fell off this spring — and just in time for the Summer Olympic Games to begin.

title: Masoud Pezeshkian, Iran’s New President, Raises Hope for a Diplomatic Opening

title: New Plan to Target Russia’s Oil Revenue Brings Debate in White House

title: Wayne S. Smith, a Leading Critic of the Embargo on Cuba, Dies at 91
content: A former State Department official, he resigned in protest in 1982 over Cuba policy, then spent decades trying to rebuild relations with the island nation.

title: Mythical Sword’s Disappearance Brings Mystery to French Village
content: Legend says the Durandal sword had been stuck in a French hillside for nearly 1,300 years. When it went missing in June, an investigation to find France’s Excalibur began.

title: Abductions Rattle Kenya as Anti-Government Protests Continue

title: Violence, Rape, Thirst, Even Organ Theft: Migrants Face Lethal Risks in Africa

title: Hungary’s Viktor Orban Travels to Russia for Meeting With Vladimir Putin
